content.description: Techy climbing which starts from the left of an arete and ascends parallel with its sister route. Same style climbing tho less injurious to the digits. Hard to pinpoint a "crux" as there is just too many of them.
content.protection: 4 bolts widely spaced. Recommendation is to descend the route and hang long, long slings (read Speed Clip description). Separate anchor unto itself.
content.location: Just to the left of Speed Clip Pantie.

content.description: A vertical face with some painful and possibly injurious monos. Extremely technical and subtle. Originally rated 10c- tho while it might well have started out that way (one never knows), it's now eroded up to it's present rating. Extremely beta dependent: the choreography is intricate.
content.protection: 4 bolts widely spaced. Fortunately this routes top anchors can be approached rather easily by following the base of the cliff as it rises east to gain the top and then walking back west to where a tree allows a 15' rappel to the two bolt anchor. One can then lower and hang long slings from the lead bolts to simulate additional protection to improve the climbing experience considerably.
content.location: This route is just right of its neighbor- Three Finger Louie. Standard rap or lower.

content.description: This wall is SE facing and is surrounded by many, many boulder problems. Very secluded and beautiful. It features two very old style bolted routes.
